subject: Marketing
title: The Brand Flywheel
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Brand Flywheel usable.

hook.text: Amazon's flywheel: lower prices attract more customers, which attracts more sellers, repeat.

buildup.text: A brand flywheel is a self-reinforcing loop where each element feeds the next.

discovery.text: Great brands design flywheels so growth compounds without proportional spending.

twist.text: The flywheel is slow to start. Most companies give up before momentum builds.

climax.text: Once spinning, the flywheel becomes a competitive moat that's nearly impossible to copy.

punchline.text: Build the loop. Then let the loop build you.

quiz.question: What makes a brand flywheel valuable?
options: Growth compounds as each element reinforces the next
It eliminates the need for any marketing budget
Flywheels only work for e-commerce companies
